page.title: 10POSBURY CLUMP
page.content: Posbury Clump is an eerie,spooky place.It is very overgrown with many wild flowers,ivies and stinging nettles.There are cowslips,wild orchids and we heard a woodpecker at work.It is the site of an old,deserted quarry.The quarry was formed by an isolated outcrop of volcanic 'trap' rising about 300 feet above the two river valleys.We saw some of the rock that was once quarried - Red Sandstone which is very common in the Crediton area.We have very red,clay soil.The trees have grown very tall.We also found gun cartridges so we know that some creatures are hunted(probably rabbits or pigeons).The Clump is about 250 million years old.It is quite a well known landmark and is easily visible from all round the area.Some of the stone was used to build part of Crediton Parish Church,about 1900 +.
